content.instructions: The Online training modules of Public Procurement would help the officers posted in Integrated Finance Divisions (IFDs) of various Ministries and Departments in examining the proposals in light of the GFRs and other instructions before its concurrence is given by the Financial Advisors.   The Online Modules of Public Procurement are equally helpful for the officers engaged in procurement function working in Administration Divisions.   The learners shall be put to test in each module so that they can check themselves and may go back to the particular portion of the module for re-emphasising the learning.
content.name: Public Procurement Framework of GOI
content.description: Government organizations procure wide variety of goods and services, including execution of works, involving huge amount of funds. They need to follow the fundamental principles of Public Procurement, viz., – transparency, fairness, competition, economy, efficiency and accountability.   General Financial Rules provide the framework that helps the officers engaged in Public Procurement function.
content.creator: Susheel Mamgain

content.source: National Academy of Indian Railways NAIR
content.name: Trainset Technology
content.description: Welcome to the Indian Railway Course on Trainsets. Rail Travel is one of the most popular modes of transportation in India. Passengers travelling by train wish for trains with better passenger amenities, better ride comfort, better safety and greater speeds. In order to fulfill these expectations, Indian Railways is inducting 400 Trainsets into its existing fleet of Rolling stocks.

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Maintain data in HR systems according to policies and procedures
   Clarify data request requirements and timelines to confirm need, nature and intended use of data
   Perform queries on HR systems based on data request requirements
   Generate reports from HR systems
   Provide data to requesting party in a secure and confidential manner
   Document the provision of data in accordance with relevant policies and procedures
competencies_v3.name: Data Management
competencies_v3.description: Prepare, structure and manage human resource (HR) data and information to assist in the analyses of business and HR issues
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Perform data maintenance, prepare requested human resource (HR) data and generate reports

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Understands basis of developing economically viable climate-resilient plans
Aware of scientific research on climate patterns and projections
Understands UNDP’s “development-first” approach, OECD’S a “climate lens” approach, fact-based risk management approach and LECRDS Approach
Cognizant of how climate-resilient development differs from traditional development
Identifies climate stressors and utilizes appropriate climate information
Aware of threats of climate change on current sustainable development and a severe threat to future sustainable development (high confidence; medium evidence, high agreement)
competencies_v3.name: Climate-Resilient Development
competencies_v3.description: Identify, evaluate, select, implement, and adjust actions to reduce climate vulnerabilities and improve development outcomes.
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Understands the concept of climate resilient development

content.purpose: Introduction to Emerging Technologies for Governance(Hindi)

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Roll out data guidelines, laws, statutes and regulations within the organisation
   Develop detailed guides on how to appropriately handle data throughout its lifecycle
   Communicate internal standards for information life-cycle management to employees
   Obtain necessary approvals when gathering, handling, processing, storing and using data
   Oversee transfer of data within the organisation
   Monitor compliance with data policies, workflows and rules
   Investigate data breaches
competencies_v3.name: Data Governance-Learning
competencies_v3.description: Develop and implement guidelines, laws, and regulations across the organisation for the handling of data at various stages in its lifecycle as well as the provision of advice on proper data handling and resolution of data breaches in a range of complex, ambiguous or multi-faceted contexts
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Implement guidelines, laws, statutes and regulations on appropriate handling of data

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Review the data requirements required for the analytics project
 Ingest data from different data sources into the analytics platform using the tools and/or programming language
 Cleanse and transform the data according to the data requirements to support the analytics project
 Resolve and follow up with any issues arising during the data preparation
competencies_v3.name: Data Analytics System Design
competencies_v3.description: Integrate the use of data analytics in the production environment for the identification of bottlenecks and system improvements
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Ingest and prepare the data for analytics

competencies_v3.competencyArea: Data Analytics and Information Technology Management
competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Implement guidelines to safeguard data accuracy, cleanliness and integrity
 Collect and prepare data sets for analysis, simulation and forecasting
 Identify data quality issues
 Conduct deep-dive analyses to identify patterns and trends in data sets
competencies_v3.name: Data Mining and Modelling
competencies_v3.description: Establish and deploy data modelling techniques to support narrative and predictive analytics efforts and identify trends and patterns for simulation and forecasting purposes
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Address potential data quality issues

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Understands basic AI terminologies and concepts, specifically related to the three key areas of cognitive systems, robotics, and machine learning 
Recognises and utilises established definitions of AI for informed research on AI 
Aware of knowledge representations (how computers represent knowledge)
competencies_v3.name: Artificial Intelligence Application
competencies_v3.description: Understand and apply artificial intelligence (AI) to technological artifacts, while assessing its benefits and challenges.
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Understands the  three areas of AI

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Generate reports on trends to aid management decision making
 Generate reports on risks to aid management decision-making
 Extract and validate data
for analysis
 Use applicable software for data extraction and analysis
 Integrate information from multiple datasets
 Apply data modelling techniques to identify underlying trends and patterns in data using statistical computing tools, methods and procedures
 Identify patterns across multiple data sets to derive insights
 Develop hypotheses for implementing data analytics activities
 Use appropriate analytics platforms, analytical tools, statistical methods and analytical approaches given specific analytics and reporting
requirements
competencies_v3.name: Data Analytics
competencies_v3.description: Apply data extraction and analytic methods to analyse and evaluate financial and non-financial information and provide business intelligence
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Apply data extraction and analysis using software

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Understands the extent and scope of IoT, including its application in various domains (agriculture, healthcare, manufacturing, etc.) 
Recognises the importance of sensors and sensing techniques in adding digital intelligence to physical devices 
Visualises and communicates the intersection between human culture and digital information systems 
Aware of basic IoT terminology (IoT products, sensors, IoT smart devices, etc.)
competencies_v3.name: Internet of Things Management
competencies_v3.description: Understand, identify, interpret, and develop IoT solutions towards pre-determined objectives, and improve existing processes.
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Understands IoT  scope

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Maintains updated knowledge on emerging technologies ranging from big data and smartphones to artificial intelligence (AI) and Internet of Things (IoT) 
Describes emerging technologies with relevant examples 
Understands that emerging technologies can be incremental as well as disruptive
competencies_v3.name: Emerging Technology
competencies_v3.description: Knowledge of developments and new applications of emerging technologies and their benefits, challenges, and applications to government processes.
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Maintains updated  database

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Identify areas with meaningful data for collection
   Carry out collection of data in formats ideal for easy manipulation
   Carry out basic business statistical operations
   Proficient in basic Microsoft Excel functionalities
competencies_v3.name: Data and Statistical Analytics
competencies_v3.description: Identify data sets for application of statistical techniques to analyse and interpret large complex data to uncover trends or patterns in order to locate and define new process improvement opportunities
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Carry out collection of data for data analytics processing

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Translate IT policies and practices into practical action steps and operating procedures for respective business units
   Monitor existing IT infrastructure and processes
   Analyse feedback and requirements of internal and external
competencies_v3.name: IT Governance
competencies_v3.description: Set and monitor IT infrastructure, information, digital services and associated technology. This involves developing policies and practices to govern the organisation's approach toward handling and using IT products and services in order to ensure conformance with regulations and accountability in decision making in alignment with the business strategic plans and service standards
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Develop and implement standard operating procedures

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Identify data sources which fulfil research and analysis requirements
Perform database queries across multiple sources to extract relevant data
Process data following standard procedures to facilitate data analysis
Organise data into appropriate chart elements to report analytics outputs
competencies_v3.name: Data Analytics
competencies_v3.description: Organise and analyse structured or unstructured data to create insights systematically
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Identify and process data according to required formats

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Support technology implementation plans
Apply technologies and systems for day-to-day operations or processes
Support applications of evaluated technologies with basic troubleshooting
competencies_v3.name: Technology and Systems Application
competencies_v3.description: Apply and integrate evaluated technologies into the organisation’s operations or processes to achieve the desired outcomes
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Apply evaluated technologies in organisation’s operations or processes

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Inspect ULDs to assess their serviceability
Execute labelling and marking procedures on ULDs
Identify data and documentation essential for ULDs operations
Build up and break down ULDs in accordance with safety requirements and SOPs
Operate ULDs in accordance with established regulations and procedures
competencies_v3.name: Unit Load Devices Operations
competencies_v3.description: Implement and develop standards for the handling, deployment and maintenance of Unit Load Devices (ULDs)
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Follow established processes and procedures to build up and break down ULDs

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Identify the impact of internal and external factors on the interdependencies within a business unit based on identified sources of disruptive events 
Document crisis responses, communications procedures and recovery activity data
Assist in coordinating and integrating crisis response and recovery activities in accordance with recovery and business continuity plans
Execute actions in response to disruptive events based on ‘return to normal’ procedures of crisis management plans
Collate post-crisis feedback from relevant stakeholders to highlight areas for improvement
Participate in the organisation’s emergency control exercises to validate crisis management plans and ensure organisational readiness
competencies_v3.name: Crisis Management
competencies_v3.description:
Apply strategies designed to enable an organisation to deal with disruptive events by planning for responses to potential crises, establishing monitoring systems and training systems,
communicating both internally and externally, and leading recovery processes
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Execute plans and collate post-crisis feedback

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Understands the rules and procedures in the organisation
Respects and follows the rules and other norms of working
Understands Civil Services values and acts accordingly
Executes work according to expectations
competencies_v3.name: Commitment to the Organisation
competencies_v3.description: Aligns behaviours and interests with the needs and goals of the organisation.
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Aligns self with the organisation

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Pays attention to detail to obtain comprehensive information
Is knowledgeable of the policies and standards of his/her own department and adheres to them while working
Willingness to consult superiors and peers in order to validate or reconfirm the details
Respects confidential information
competencies_v3.name: Attention to Detail
competencies_v3.description: Having an underlying drive to being thorough and meticulous and to comply with procedures, rules, guidelines, and standards. Digs deeper and strives to reduce uncertainties and errors.
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName:
Pays Attention 
to Detail

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Understands what is required in their role and how this contributes to the Departmental
priorities
Considers how their job impacts colleagues in their own and other Departments; takes an active interest in expanding knowledge of areas related to their role.
competencies_v3.name: Strategic Thinking
competencies_v3.description: Ability to understand the dynamic internal and external environment and its impact.  Responds to the opportunities and challenges for the betterment of the society.
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Understands own work

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Is open and honest in one’s dealings with others
Honours commitments made to others
Acts in ways to avoid conflict of interest - perceived or real ”“ for example -by disclosing potential issues on time
Honest and open in all communications
Gives frank and honest opinion when sought
Follows the rules and regulations and is guided by Public Service values
Does not share information loosely with others
competencies_v3.name: Integrity
competencies_v3.description: Consistently behaves in an open, fair, and transparent manner; honours one’s commitments; and works to uphold the Public Service Values.
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Acts ethically

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Extract tax and tax- related information for analysis to assist in monitoring tax risks
 Comply with tax controls and policies to aid monitoring of tax risks
Identify and follow-up on Non-compliances
competencies_v3.name: Tax Risk Management
competencies_v3.description: Review tax risk frameworks to ensure risks are minimised and managed properly
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Assist to ascertain tax risk areas

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Administer voluntary exit processes according to policies and procedures
Draft documentation required for voluntary exits
Provide information to employees on voluntary exit policies
Maintain comprehensive records of voluntary employee exits
competencies_v3.name: Voluntary Exit Management
competencies_v3.description: Establish and implement frameworks, guidelines, policies and processes to manage voluntary exits
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Administer processes for voluntary employee exits

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Aware of the benefits of stakeholder engagement, specifically towards the pursuit of short-term and long-term objectives 
Recognises relevant internal and external stakeholders
Documents internal and external stakeholder positions on organisational, project, and/or departmental goals
competencies_v3.name: Stakeholder Management
competencies_v3.description: Effectively build, engage, sustain, and manage relationships with stakeholders to ensure successful outcomes for short-term and long-term objectives.
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Understands stakeholder engagement

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Understands the underlying intent of project resource management 
Describes the types of project resources required for successful execution and completion of a project (people, capital, etc.)
Recognises the characteristics of a ‘resource’ and ‘resource plan’
competencies_v3.name: Project Resource Planning
competencies_v3.description: Develop and assess project resource plans to ensure optimal resource utilisation.
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Understands the intent of project resource management

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Understands the extent and scope of IoT, including its application in various domains (agriculture, healthcare, manufacturing, etc.) 
Recognises the importance of sensors and sensing techniques in adding digital intelligence to physical devices 
Visualises and communicates the intersection between human culture and digital information systems 
Aware of basic IoT terminology (IoT products, sensors, IoT smart devices, etc.)
competencies_v3.name: Internet of Things Management
competencies_v3.description: Understand, identify, interpret, and develop IoT solutions towards pre-determined objectives, and improve existing processes.
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Understands IoT  scope

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Aware of various data collection sources (government websites, Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha questions, private sector reports, census data, academic journals, etc.)  
Recognises credible data sources and corresponding data collection instruments 
Distinguishes between primary and secondary sources of data 
Alerts the team if required data already exists
competencies_v3.name: Data collection and analysis
competencies_v3.description: Proactively collect, clean, analyse, and communicate data from a range of stakeholders and sources to reach a conclusion and support decision making.
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Aware of data collection sources and instruments

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Understands scenario planning as a methodology for identifying and addressing risks and uncertainties
Documents current and future challenges the Indian government might face 
Aware of the rationale and objective of scenario plans (setting agenda, determining driving forces, etc.)
competencies_v3.name: Scenario Planning
competencies_v3.description: Understand and develop scenario plans to anticipate and solve for risks and uncertainties the Indian government might face, while managing social interests and government priorities.
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Understands scenario planning

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Perform root cause analyses
Facilitate execution of small projects or project modules
Implement realistic project plans based on the understanding of project objectives and project scope
Utilise appropriate methods and tools to track and drive progress of projects against set plans and timelines
Identify risks to the success of projects or modules and take appropriate actions to manage them
Collaborate and communicate effectively with relevant internal and external stakeholders directly impacting the projects
Deploy resources to different parts of the projects for efficient and effective completion
Track project deliverables against project schedules
Monitor costs, timescales and resources used and take basic corrective actions in case of misalignment
competencies_v3.name: Project Management
competencies_v3.description: Plan and manage all aspects of a project, including allocation of people resources, budget and time management, stakeholder engagement and problem resolution
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Project management - Small Projects

competencies_v3.name: Wealth Planning Administration
competencies_v3.description: Manage, review and administer proposed wealth planning tools and/or structures, in accordance with the organisation's policies and procedures and wealth planning laws and regulations

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Identify relevant quality assurance standards
   Implement quality assurance practices in day-to-day tasks
   Monitor quality performance levels based on quality assurance guidelines
   Conduct random quality checks and document results to measure quality performance levels
   Identify lapses in self- quality performance levels
   Determine and/or seek guidance on how to realign quality standards for performance
competencies_v3.name: Product/Service Quality Assurance
competencies_v3.description: Develop, implement and monitor practice of clear quality expectations and standards aligned to the organisation's values and business objectives
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Adhere to quality standards and identify quality gaps

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Understands the types of project risks (internal and external) and basic ways to manage them (avoid, mitigate, transfer, and accept)
Categorises the three types of internal risks (human-factor, technological and physical)
Summarises the types of external risks based on the reliability of forecasts (economic, natural and political risks)
competencies_v3.name: Project Risk Identification
competencies_v3.description: Identify, prepare and assess for internal and external risk impacting the project using a situational analysis framework to mitigate negative effects and maximise positive effects for project success.
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Aware of the types of project risks

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Implement audits and checks to determine activities are performed in accordance with SOPs
Communicate SOPs to staff 
Collate feedback from staff and determine improvement opportunities
Recommend improvements to SOPs
competencies_v3.name: Standard Operating Procedures Development
competencies_v3.description: Implement and develop Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and enforce compliance with SOPs
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Administer operations to ensure and enforce compliance with SOPs

competencies_v3.selectedLevelDescription:
Recognise triggers in the service environment that may lead to potential service challenges
 Use service recovery procedures to respond to service challenges
 Escalate unresolved service challenges
competencies_v3.name: Service Challenges
competencies_v3.description: Develop a framework to manage and mitigate service challenges and feedback from customers
competencies_v3.selectedLevelName: Respond to challenging service situations

content.instructions:
To strengthen and enhance the process of identifying socially excluded and their inclusion in the social fabric during this pandemic condition. DAY NRLM and NIRD have collaborated to develop an audio video-led training course on social inclusion aspects of DAY NRLM.

It's merely a challenging period for the states to provide the capacity building for the mission functionaries to deliver the expected roles and responsibilities in terms of training. This course content consists of 4 modules with an assessment tool and provides the target audience- mission functionaries from the state, and district to block in order to benefit from the video led training on social inclusion online.

The course was developed as a result of an extensive process of consultations and studies of best practices across India and has been based on the Tool kit with volumes 1-4 of Manuals of mainstreaming social inclusion DAY_NRLM.

Module no 1 - Introduction and concepts of social inclusion in NRLM.

 Module no 2 - Inclusion Elderly, PwDs, WID and other vulnerable: Strategies, approach and interventions.

 Module no 3 - Access to Rights and Entitlements of Vulnerable.

 Module no 4 - Financial inclusion and Livelihood development of the Vulnerable.
organisation: NIRDPR National Institute of Rural Development and Panchayati Raj
content.source: NIRDPR National Institute of Rural Development and Panchayati Raj
content.name: Mainstreaming Social Inclusion in DAY-NRLM
content.purpose: Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana: National Rural Livelihoods Mission (DAY_NRLM)
content.description: Social inclusion can be defined as the process of improving the conditions of participation in society for people who are disadvantaged on the basis of age, sex, disability, race, ethnicity, origin, religion, economic or another status, through enhanced opportunities, access to resources, voice and respect for rights. Thus social inclusion is both a process and a goal.
content.creator: Dr. Radhika Rani Ch

content.instructions:
Keeping this in mind we have launched the course ‘AI for Governance: An Introduction'. This course aims at building awareness of AI and other emerging technologies among government officials enabling them to make informed data-driven decisions thereby impacting lives for the social good.

After this course, you will be able to:

  • Understand how AI-powered and other Emerging Technologies are critical for good governance
  • Identify the applications of different Emerging Technologies across sectors and government
  • Identify work problems where the use of selected AI-driven and other Emerging Technologies can provide a solution
  • Appreciate the limitation of Emerging Technologies and in which areas it may not be prudent to use these technologies
content.name: AI for Governance : An Introduction

content.description:
Welcome to the ‘AI for Governance: An Introduction' Course!

Technological advances have always been key agents of change in how we work, interact, and live. There is an unprecedented pace of technological innovation in all fields from computing and artificial intelligence to drones and virtual reality. Public Policy for any country is a complex task, and the complexity increases further if the country is as large, populous, and diverse as India. AI-based technologies provide an avenue for better decision-making and can help improve the policy-making process. In our view, these technologies supplement the experience and expertise of policymakers and aid their decision-making. As a result, we view AI not as Artificial Intelligence but as Augmented Intelligence.

content.instructions:
The Comprehensive Online Modified Module on Induction Training (COMMIT) Course has been conceptualized for the training of frontline staff functioning in various Departments in the State Governments. The modules focus majorly on development of soft skills essential for improving customer orientation and quality service delivery to the citizen for the benefit of officials functioning at cutting edge level in State Governments.
The course includes 12 behavioural and 3 functional e-Modules of total twenty-hour duration. The Course will be highly useful as part of the Induction Training Programme (ITP) for newly recruited frontline state government functionaries being implemented by the State Administrative Training Institutes (ATIs).
The course can be utilised as the online component of blended ITP, which allows officers and faculty advantage of flexibility and convenience of an online course while retaining the benefits of the face-to-face classroom experience.

content.instructions: Water on Earth is a unique feature that clearly differentiates our ‘Blue Planet’ from others in the solar system. Liquid water is commonly encountered in oceans, lakes, and rivers on the Earth’s surface. The earth is 71 % water. It can be classified as: 97 % - salty and found in the oceans and 3 % - freshwater. Hence the need of wetland conservation.

content.description:
The Pradhan Mantri Awaas Yojana - Gramin (PMAY-G) is one of the flagship programmes of the Ministry of Rural Development, Government of India which aims to provide housing for the rural poor in India. 

The scheme, launched in 2016, aims at providing pucca houses with basic amenities to all houseless and vulnerable households by 2022. Under the PMAY-G programme, implementation support and financial assistance for the construction of houses are provided to the identified beneficiaries. In addition, facilities such as toilets, LPG connections, electricity connections, drinking water, etc., are also provided through convergence with other schemes of the Government of India.

The course can be utilised as the online component of blended ITP, which allows officers and faculty advantage of flexibility and convenience of an online course while retaining the benefits of the face-to-face classroom experience.

content.description:
The Comprehensive Online Modified Module on Induction Training (COMMIT) Course has been conceptualized for the training of frontline staff functioning in various Departments in the State Governments. The modules focus majorly on development of soft skills essential for improving customer orientation and quality service delivery to the citizen for the benefit of officials functioning at cutting edge level in State Governments.
The course includes 12 behavioural and 3 functional e-Modules of total twenty-hour duration. The Course will be highly useful as part of the Induction Training Programme (ITP) for newly recruited frontline state government functionaries being implemented by the State Administrative Training Institutes (ATIs).
The course can be utilised as the online component of blended ITP, which allows officers and faculty advantage of flexibility and convenience of an online course while retaining the benefits of the face-to-face classroom experience.

content.instructions:
Implementation of this programme requires highly motivated and knowledgeable personnel. Also the Gram Panchayats concerned officials have to be suitably capacitated. Therefore, the Ministry of Rural Development, Govt. of India has put in place a specially designed capacity building programme and the National Institute of Rural Development and Panchayati Raj (NIRD & PR), Hyderabad has been designated as Nodal Agency to conduct the capacity building programmes for State Nodal Officers and Charge Officers of SAGY through SIRDs at the State level. Since 2017-18, NIRDPR has been conducting capacity building programmes for charge officers on regular basis. Keeping in view the importance of SAGY programme following objectives have been framed to achieve the aim of SAGY programme:

Objectives

-          To orient the participants about the importance of SAGY programme and its role in creating model villages

-          To equip the participants with the strategies of SAGY scheme for effective implementation.

-          To impart the skills and techniques of participatory rural appraisal in participants PRA for effective planning processes.

-          To demonstrate successful rural development created in SAGY Gram Panchayats.
content.name: Saansad Adarsh Gram Yojana  (SAGY)

content.description:
Saansad Adarsh Gram Yojana (SAGY), as a path breaking initiative in rural development was launched by the Hon’ble Prime Minister on 11 October 2014 with the objective of creating Adarsh Grams (Ideal Villages) across the country. The scheme Guidelines called upon the Hon’ble Members of Parliament to make one Gram Panchayat of their choice a Model Village by 2016, and another two by 2019 and thereafter every year one Gram Panchyat each year till 2024. The Hon’ble MPs have adopted in the first phase of SAGY (2014-2019) total 1510 Gram Panchayats and in the second phase of SAGY (2020-2024) which is ongoing 541 Gram Panchayats have been identified till now. These ‘Adarsh Grams’ are to serve as ‘nucleus of health, cleanliness, greenery and cordiality’ within the village community becoming schools of local development and governance, inspiring neighbouring Gram Panchayats.

The Saansad Adarsh Gram Yojana (SAGY) converges resources available from a range of existing Central Sector, Centrally Sponsored and State Schemes to achieve the programme objectives and as such, no additional funding is deemed necessary.

The Gram Panchayats under the guidance of Hon’ble MPs follow a structured process of environment-creation, social-mobilisation, resource-mapping and participatory development planning

content.instructions:
Throughout the course, economic terms and notions are explained in plain English and are amply illustrated by graphs and animations for increased understanding (... and entertainment!). Each module begins with a 'Story' simulation in which you, the course participant, act as the member of a fictional committee, a 'think tank' who must assist Doreen, your Minister of Health, in improving the health system of her country using economics-based decisions. And each module concludes with a set of interactive reviewing exercises to solidify your knowledge of newly acquired material.

The ten thematic modules of the course are grouped in three clusters, each following its own color scheme for easy recognition:

Cluster 1:

Contains two modules: 1. Efficiency and 2. Equity - two examples of why Health Economics is important as a topic of study. Efficiency is a particularly good example of how Health Economics concepts can be used to foster communication between Ministries of Finance and Ministries of Health. Another example is equity, which studies how health benefits are distributed among the population of a country. Knowledge about equity in health can equip a Minister of Health to restructure the Health System so that benefits are more fairly distributed.

 

Cluster 2:

Gives a step-by-step introduction to the market mechanism. The five modules, numbered 3 through 7, help us understand what health care markets are. We will cover supply and demand and how they interact, as well as what problems exist with markets in health in particular. The Story covers all five modules of this cluster and, as you can read in Module 3, we find Minister Doreen in a prickly dilemma: which donor agency is speaking the truth as to whether to use markets or not in health care provision.

 

Cluster 3

Finally deals with who pays for what in the health sector. This is an important area and it touches on issues that we explored both in Clusters 1 and 2 such as equity, efficiency and market failures. We will look at resource mobilization for the health sector; at risk-pooling which explores how we can mitigate risks across different population groups and across time; and finally at how we allocate these resources in order to pay providers of care.
content.name: Basics of health economics

competencies_v3.name: Public Health Systems
competencies_v3.description: Plan, design, and implement policies focusing on assessing, and improving the overall public health systems

content.description: The overall goal of this course is to assist you to communicate with health economists. The materials in this course address the main concepts that (health) economists commonly use. As you learn what the concepts mean, you can effectively discuss options with them, using their own vocabulary and thus making communication easier.

competencies_v3.name: Seeking Information
competencies_v3.description: An underlying curiosity to know more about things, people, or issues. This includes ‘digging’ for exact information and keeping up-to-date with relevant knowledge.

content.description: The Panchayati Raj system in India gives the local people the opportunity to directly participate in governance. People can directly participate in the Gram Sabha and the elected representatives of a Panchayat are directly accountable to the people. In other words, we can say that Panchayati Raj is the grassroots unit of local self-government.

content.instructions: You will learn the basic aspects of Financial Management in Gram Panchayats, Financial Resources of Gram Panchayats, Gram Panchayat Budget Preparation, Gram Panchayat Accounting, Gram Panchayat Auditing, Rural Infrastructure for  Sustainable Rural Development, etc,.
content.name: Financial Management in Gram Panchayats

competencies_v3.name: Result Orientation
competencies_v3.description: High drive for achieving targets and competing against a standard of excellence.

content.description: The management of the panchayat is entrusted to the representatives elected by the people of the locality at regular intervals. The elected members are responsible to make decisions for the planning and implementation of various developmental schemes. For effective functioning of gram panchayats, the panchayats functionaries must follow certain office procedures and maintain an important record, files and registers. It helps in planning, recording and analysis of financial data, and in improving the collection and utilisation of the resources. The financial management emphasises making the best use of the available resources of gram panchayat and channelling them into proper fields of expenditure economically, effectively and efficiently. The gram panchayats as the local authority are authorised to levy, collect and appropriate some taxes, duties, tolls and fees. In order to become an institution, the panchayats need to enhance their own source revenues to finance their development initiatives. It is important that funds of gram panchayat are spent in a timely and judicious manner. The local governments are an integral part of the political system of the country to manage local affairs. To discharge their functional responsibilities and to meet evolving expectations of their constitutes, the local governments need access to funds. Under the State Panchayat Raj Act, provision is made allowing the Panchayats to raise their own source of revenues and also for the release of gran-in-aid from the State government. This course is organized into four modules and deals with the financial resources of gram panchayats, gram panchayat budget preparation, accounting and auditing.

content.instructions:
This course is designed in 5 modules which can be completed in 5 hours duration preferably over a period of 15 days.

 After completion of this course, the participants will be able to understand,

  1.    About the PMAY-G: the rural housing programme in India.
  2.    Various processes such as the selection process of beneficiaries, monetary assistance and technical assistance such as training and design typologies, etc., are involved in the programme.
  3.    Understand various governance and monitoring systems such as AwaasSoft, Social Audit and other modules used in PMAY-G for effective implementation and management of the programme.

content.name: Pradhan Mantri Awaas Yojana – Gramin (PMAY-G): Planning, Implementation and Management of the Rural Housing Programme

content.description:
The Pradhan Mantri Awaas Yojana - Gramin (PMAY-G) is one of the flagship programmes of the Ministry of Rural Development, Government of India which aims to provide housing for the rural poor in India. 

The scheme, launched in 2016, aims at providing pucca houses with basic amenities to all houseless and vulnerable households by 2022. Under the PMAY-G programme, implementation support and financial assistance for the construction of houses are provided to the identified beneficiaries. In addition, facilities such as toilets, LPG connections, electricity connections, drinking water, etc., are also provided through convergence with other schemes of the Government of India.

content.instructions:
This module explains basic constructs of e-governance – the strategy of employing digital technologies in accelerating the processes of governance and the related concepts associated with it. It also describes in an easy-to-understand manner the flagship Digital India program of the Government of India. After the completion of the module”, the learners would be able to : 

1.Explain the terms “Information Communication Technologies- ICTs”, “Emerging technologies-ETs”  and “Digital Technologies” with related examples.

2.Appreciate the advantages and disadvantages of digital technologies

3.Understand the term ‘Governance’

4.Differentiate between “Governance” and “Government

5.Understand the aim of governance with special reference to eight characteristics of good governance

6.List some of the ills of Governance

7.List primary stakeholders of Governance and types of possible interactions using digital technologies.

8.State the basic definition of “e-governance” and its examples both in the Indian context and elsewhere

9.Differentiate between the terms ‘e-government” and “e-governance”

10.Delineate the vision and pillars of the Digital India Programme of India.

11. Understand the role of digital technologies in achieving 17 SDGs
content.name: Basics of e-Governance & Digital India

content.description: This module explains basic constructs of e-governance – the strategy of employing digital technologies in accelerating the processes of governance and the related concepts associated with it. It also describes in an easy-to-understand manner the flagship Digital India program of the Government of India.

content.instructions: Smart Grid is interconnection of modern communication and information technologies along with control and automation process across entire electricity sector comprising of generation, transmission, distribution and the consumer. The aim of smart grid is to make existing infrastructure more robust, reliable and efficient by using intelligent tools and technologies, encourage active demand side participation, ensuring sustainability of supply through renewable integration, promoting green and clean environment and provide incentives for efficient production electricity.  This course will provide the learner an insight to the Smart Grid with its underlying phillosophy, technology and constraints.
content.name: Smart Grid Fundamentals
content.purpose: The what, why and how of Smart Grid explained.

competencies_v3.name: Desire for Knowledge
competencies_v3.description: Keeps up-to-date with relevant knowledge and technology shares the latest developments with others and advocates the application of acquired knowledge.

content.description: Smart Grid is a reality now-a-days and the intelligent grid is more than a necessity now. This course is dedicated towards understanding the Smart Grid and its underlying principles.
